metadata.name: Search Services
metadata.description: This module deploys a Search Service.

Required. The name of the Azure Cognitive Search service to create or update. Search service names must only contain lowercase letters, digits or dashes, cannot use dash as the first two or last one characters, cannot contain consecutive dashes, and must be between 2 and 60 characters in length. Search service names must be globally unique since they are part of the service URI (https://<name>.search.windows.net). You cannot change the service name after the service is created.
Optional. Defines the options for how the data plane API of a Search service authenticates requests. Must remain an empty object {} if 'disableLocalAuth' is set to true.
Optional. When set to true, calls to the search service will not be permitted to utilize API keys for authentication. This cannot be set to true if 'authOptions' are defined.
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
Optional. Describes a policy that determines how resources within the search service are to be encrypted with Customer Managed Keys.

Optional. Applicable only for the standard3 SKU. You can set this property to enable up to 3 high density partitions that allow up to 1000 indexes, which is much higher than the maximum indexes allowed for any other SKU. For the standard3 SKU, the value is either 'default' or 'highDensity'. For all other SKUs, this value must be 'default'.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Network specific rules that determine how the Azure Cognitive Search service may be reached.

Optional. The number of partitions in the search service; if specified, it can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, or 12. Values greater than 1 are only valid for standard SKUs. For 'standard3' services with hostingMode set to 'highDensity', the allowed values are between 1 and 3.
Optional. Configuration details for private endpoints. For security reasons, it is recommended to use private endpoints whenever possible.
Optional. The sharedPrivateLinkResources to create as part of the search Service.

Optional. This value can be set to 'enabled' to avoid breaking changes on existing customer resources and templates. If set to 'disabled', traffic over public interface is not allowed, and private endpoint connections would be the exclusive access method.
Optional. The number of replicas in the search service. If specified, it must be a value between 1 and 12 inclusive for standard SKUs or between 1 and 3 inclusive for basic SKU.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Defines the SKU of an Azure Cognitive Search Service, which determines price tier and capacity limits.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The name of logs that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of metrics that will be streamed.
Optional. The name of the diagnostic setting, if deployed. If left empty, it defaults to "<resourceName>-diagnosticSettings".

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic storage account. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.

Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic log analytics workspace. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Resource ID of the diagnostic event hub authorization rule for the Event Hubs namespace in which the event hub should be created or streamed to.

Optional. Name of the diagnostic event hub within the namespace to which logs are streamed. Without this, an event hub is created for each log category. For security reasons, it is recommended to set diagnostic settings to send data to either storage account, log analytics workspace or event hub.
Optional. Tags to help categorize the resource in the Azure portal.

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.description: Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.

metadata.name: Private Endpoints
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint.
Required. Name of the private endpoint resource to create.
Required. Resource ID of the subnet where the endpoint needs to be created.
Required. Resource ID of the resource that needs to be connected to the network.
Optional. Application security groups in which the private endpoint IP configuration is included.
Optional. The custom name of the network interface attached to the private endpoint.
Optional. A list of IP configurations of the private endpoint. This will be used to map to the First Party Service endpoints.
Required. Subtype(s) of the connection to be created. The allowed values depend on the type serviceResourceId refers to.
Optional. The private DNS zone group configuration used to associate the private endpoint with one or multiple private DNS zones. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.

Optional. Array of role assignment objects that contain the 'roleDefinitionIdOrName' and 'principalId' to define RBAC role assignments on this resource. In the roleDefinitionIdOrName attribute, you can provide either the display name of the role definition, or its fully qualified ID in the following format: '/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/roleDefinitions/c2f4ef07-c644-48eb-af81-4b1b4947fb11'.
Optional. Tags to be applied on all resources/resource groups in this deployment.
Optional. Custom DNS configurations.
Optional. Manual PrivateLink Service Connections.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).

properties.notes: [if(equals(parameters('lock'), 'CanNotDelete'), 'Cannot delete resource or child resources.', 'Cannot modify the resource or child resources.')]

metadata.name: Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Private Endpoint Private DNS Zone Group.
Conditional. The name of the parent private endpoint. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. Array of private DNS zone resource IDs. A DNS zone group can support up to 5 DNS zones.
Optional. The name of the private DNS zone group.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
The name of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource ID of the private endpoint DNS zone group.
The resource group the private endpoint DNS zone group was deployed into.
Required. The IDs of the principals to assign the role to.
Required. The name of the role to assign. If it cannot be found you can specify the role definition ID instead.
Required. The resource ID of the resource to apply the role assignment to.
Optional. The principal type of the assigned principal ID.
Optional. The description of the role assignment.

Optional. The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase "foo_storage_container".
Optional. Version of the condition.
Optional. Id of the delegated managed identity resource.
The resource group the private endpoint was deployed into.
The resource ID of the private endpoint.
The name of the private endpoint.
The location the resource was deployed into.

metadata.name: Search Services Private Link Resources
metadata.description: This module deploys a Search Service Private Link Resource.
Conditional. The name of the parent searchServices. Required if the template is used in a standalone deployment.
Required. The name of the shared private link resource managed by the Azure Cognitive Search service within the specified resource group.
Required. The resource ID of the resource the shared private link resource is for.
Required. The group ID from the provider of resource the shared private link resource is for.
Required. The request message for requesting approval of the shared private link resource.

Optional. Can be used to specify the Azure Resource Manager location of the resource to which a shared private link is to be created. This is only required for those resources whose DNS configuration are regional (such as Azure Kubernetes Service).
Optional. Enable telemetry via the Customer Usage Attribution ID (GUID).
The name of the shared private link resource.
The resource ID of the shared private link resource.
The name of the resource group the shared private link resource was created in.
The name of the search service.
The resource ID of the search service.
The name of the resource group the search service was created in.
The location the resource was deployed into.
